description: Numbers whose set of base 9 digits is {0,1}.
comments: Sums of distinct powers of 9.a(n) modulo 2 is the Prouhet-Thue-Morse sequence A010060. - _Philippe Deléham_, Oct 17 2011
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n=0..1023
formula: a(n)=Sum{d(i)*9^i: i=0, 1, ..., m}, where Sum{d(i)*2^i: i=0, 1, ..., m} is the base 2 representation of n.a(n) = A097255(n)/8.a(2n) = 9*a(n), a(2n+1) = a(2n)+1.a(n)=Sum_k>=0 {A030308(n,k)*9^k}. - _Philippe Deléham_, Oct 17 2011
author: _Clark Kimberling_
